attributes.comment:
The proposed fee increase is too high and puts and unfair burden on hard-working
immigrants trying to enter the U.S. legally. Often immigrants start with low-paying
jobs and work their way up. This high cost may cause desperate people to
increase attempts at illegal entry into the country, which will results in higher
costs to secure the U.S. borders.
Except for American Indians, most American citizens' ancestors were immigrants
at one time. We should show compassion to hard-working people trying to do
what our own ancestors did.
Is it not inscribed on our own Statue of Liberty:
"Give me your tired, your poor,
Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free,
The wretched refuse of your teeming shore.
Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me,
I lift my lamp beside the golden door!"

Also, this proposed fee will be a financial hardship for people trying to adopt
children from other countries.
The fee should only increase at the rate of inflation, not 66 percent!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By J. Motl
